title: Dialogue Venues
alt_text: The chart shows a map of Germany on which the venues throughout Germany are indicated by means of small pins.

title: Number of persons in need of care by type of care provision by end of year 2013
source_annotation: Statistisches Bundesamt (2015): Pflegestatistik 2013 – Pflege im Rahmen der Pflegeversicherung Deutschlandergebnisse. Statistisches Bundesamt: Wiesbaden.

title: Number of persons in need of care by type of care provision by end of year 2013
alt_text: The chart shows that in 2013 of 2.6 million individuals needing care 1.8 million were cared for at home and 800,000 in residential care. Of those being cared for at home, 1.2 million were cared for exclusively by relatives, while 600,000 also received some professional care.
source_annotation: Statistisches Bundesamt (2015): Pflegestatistik 2013 – Pflege im Rahmen der Pflegeversicherung Deutschlandergebnisse. Statistisches Bundesamt: Wiesbaden.

title: Life expectancy at birth
alt_text: The chart shows the trend in life expectancy at birth between 1956 and 2013, differentiated by gender and by old and new federal states. Life expectancy rose significantly for all groups during the period. Women's life expectancy exceeded men's in 2013 and people in the old federal states had a higher life expectancy than those in the new federal states. In 2013, life expectancy for women was thus around 83 in both the old and new federal states, while it was 78.2 for men in the old and 77 in the new federal states. Since the late 1950s, life expectancy at birth has been increasing continuously by just under three months year on year.
source_annotation: University of California, Berkeley (USA) and Max-Planck-Institut für demografische Forschung (Germany).

title: Increases in life expectancy at birth since German reunification by gender 1990 and 2013
alt_text: The chart shows that life expectancy in the new and old federal states increased significantly between 1990 and 2013 for women and men. The rise in life expectancy overall was slightly greater in men. But men's life expectancy was still lower than women's in 2013. For women, life expectancy was around 83 in both the old and the new federal states. Since German reunification, women's life expectancy in the new federal states developed strongly and reached the same level as in the old federal states by 2013. Men's life expectancy in the new federal states underwent a similar development, but there still remaines a difference of 1.2 years. Men's life expectance in the old federal states was thus 73.2 in 2013, while it was 77 in the new federal states.
source_annotation: University of California, Berkeley (USA) and Max-Planck-Institut für demografische Forschung (Germany).

title: Increases in life expectancy since German reunification 1990 and 2013
alt_text: The chart shows that life expectancy at birth rose from 75.3 in 1990 to 80.5 in 2013.
source_annotation: University of California, Berkeley (USA) and Max-Planck-Institut für demografische Forschung (Germany).

title: Trends in obesity prevalence among adults by age group 1999 and 2013
alt_text: The chart shows that the proportion of men and women with a BMI over 30 increased between 1999 and 2013 in all five shown age groups between 18 and 64, with the risk of becoming obese increasing with age. The proportion of men and women with a BMI of 30 and above is largest among those aged 55 to 64. Every fourth man and every fifth woman in this age group was obese in 2013. In the case of young adults (18 to 24) this only applies to every 20th person, but this group shows the largest percentage increases at 65 percent. This finding is also relevant in view of the increasing prevalence of obesity among children and adolescents.

title: Trends in obesity prevalence among adults by federal states 1999 and 2013
alt_text: The chart shows that the proportion of obese adults incrased between 1999 and 2013 in Germany as well as in many individual federal states. The national average was 11.5 percent in 1999 and 15.7 percent in 2013. The figures for the federal states of Saxony-Anhalt, Thuringia, Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, Brandenburg and Rhineland-Palatinate were above this 2013 value, with adult obesity rates between 17.1 and 20.6 percent. The rates in the federal states of Baden-Württemberg, Berlin, Hamburg, Bremen, Schleswig-Holstein were below the national average, amounting to 11.1 and 14.6 percent.

config:
{
  "geotiff": "07-02-miv",
  "accessor": "center",
  "ordinalAccessor": "center",
  "shape": "square",
  "legendTitle": "Zentralörtliche Einstufung",
  "sizes": [5, 10],
  "height": 350,
  "colorRange": ["#FE5072", "#810019"],
  "geotiffLegendTitle": "Fahrtzeit zum nächsten Zentrum in Minuten",
  "geotiffLegend": [
    {"color": "rgb(158,235,255)", "label": "0 - 10"},
    {"color": "rgb(128,207,255)", "label": "10 - 20"},
    {"color": "rgb(99,180,228)", "label": "20 - 30"},
    {"color": "rgb(67,153,200)", "label": "30 - 40"},
    {"color": "rgb(7,120,165)", "label": "40 - 50"},

}
source_annotation: Erreichbarkeitsmodell des BBSR. Geometrische Grundlage: BKG, Kreise (status: 31 December 2012)
footnote:
A "Mittelzentrum" has at least 30,000 to 40,000 inhabitants and typically offers the following facilities: department store, hospital, medical specialists, hotel, old people's residential home, theatre, museum, youth recreation centre, further education college, library, sizable sports facility, railway station.
An "Oberzentrum" has 200,000 to 300,000 inhabitants and typically offers the following facilities: specialist shops, larger banks and financial institutions, institution of higher education, specialist hospital, academic library, sports stadium, major railway station.
